> An insult to his logic was definitely a test to Tucson's already short t=
emper.  Yet he knew he had to keep that in check if he was to keep his posi=
tion.  He turns to Wheelie with a narrowed brow.  Yet not one word is said.=
  He then raises it.
> 
> " Hmmmm... So that's how you see me?  If I'm not =
mistaken Wheelie I believe you have just crossed the line of insubordinatio=
n.  I'm giving you a chance to be part of the team but I see nothing in ret=
urn on your part.  Well, care to explain to me the Autobot code of honor an=
d what happens when a soldier behaves out of line, going as far as insultin=
g a Prime Officer?  You seem to be quite intelligent, go on, tell me."
> 
>=
 Rattrap and Straight Shot look to Wheelie in shock.
> 
> " Looks like a ce=
rtain little go cart's in for some serious discipline. "
> 
> Straight Shot=
 swallows hard.
> 
> " His voice, it sounds just like Ratchet's voice when =
he was ready ta lose it."
> 
> Rattrap watches with amusement.
> 
> " Ooohh=
h so that's where Tucson's temper comes from.  Yep Wheelie is in big troubl=
e."
> 
> Tucson eyes Wheelie with arms folded in his chest.  His stare indi=
cative of Ratchet when he was ready to lose his temper.
> 

At this point, =
Wheelie stood up, "Yes, I say you are wrong.  There's no such thing as a sp=
ace bridge that strong.  You would simply see it from afar, with our own op=
tics the sensors abar.  You cannot remotely hide such a hting, in the techn=
ology of our time or even that thing.  To do such a thing, to rip apart tim=
e, is stupidly absurd, I call it this time.  So if you are going to say we =
should waste our time going after what does not exist, I say thee nay."

Wh=
eelie went on, "So, stop wasting oru time for such a stupid thing, or I wil=
l go out on my own and bring.  Rodimus is my friend, I won't leave him alon=
e to face his end.  If you are goin to be a boron, then I shall call you a =
nimrod and boron."

Hissing, "Now, I would say you are wasting our time, on=
 pointless things that we needn't to whine.  So I say, I think you want my =
friend dead today."

At the Laurel and Hardy back and forth of Rattrap and =
Straight SHot, Wheelie just laughed, "And you bring up Ratchet?  Well he's =
dead.  MEgatron blew off his head.  And you seem to want Rodimus to end the=
 same way.  So I shall now not leave my friend astray."

And without a furt=
her word, Wheelie transformed to his vehicle mode, and raced off!

OOC - Th=
is is how I see the character - at this point, he thinks it's utter nonsens=
e to waste time looking for a Space Bridge that there's no evidence of or a=
nything remotely suggesting, based upon Tuscon having a 'hunch' so he's goi=
ng insubordinate and off on his own.  TO him, a Space Bridge would e imposs=
ible to hdie (a la the third Transformers movie Dark of the Moon), and so w=
asting time scanning for it is a fool's errand.  So he's going off to 'look=
' for Rodimus on his own, unless stopped or otherwis einterfered with as he=
's afraid that Tuscon is purposefully stalling to prevent them from going a=
fter Rodimus.  He respects Leo Prime, but he's friends with Rorimus, and he=
 has a very low regard for Tuscon, and at this point in his processor Tusco=
n deciding to check for something to him that has infinitesimal chances of =
having been done and stall a gridwide search is abaondment of his friend.  =
Anyways, wondrful posting and good luck!
